lines.text: And now my friend, the first-a rule of Italian driving.
[Franco rips off his rear-view mirror and throws it out of the car]
What's-a behind me is not important.
Sir? We can't catch 'em.
Whaddaya mean?
They must be doing 180. We don't even have a fixed-wing that'll go that fast!
So Mike... what is this, a vintage car event?
Well Smitty, you know some things get meaner as they get older.

[Answering telephone]
Hi, Sam.
Bannon?
It's on, we're go.

[about the Gumball Rally]
Look, I've been giving this matter a lot of thought, and... look, you don't have anything to lose. I mean, to you this thing is just a stunt! I've got a position at this university. I've got a shot at tenure... all I have to do is stay out of trouble a couple more years, I'll be set for life. I can't risk that!
It's not a risk... it's a challenge.

[about their Ferrari]
How's the bambina?
She's a-fulla gas, she's-a wait for you!
Hey, you make a good Italian!
Hey Franco! Your mother called, she's been looking all over for you!
Now you make jokes on my mother, huh?
No... about your mother, not on your mother. I wouldn't get *on* your mother!

[their Camaro is running hot]
Jeez, can't we turn off the heater?
Either the engine gets hot, or we get hot!
Well, I'm about to have a stroke!
A stroke? I should be so lucky!
Andy, I need an inspiration.
Yeah, it's that time of the morning.
Something to make the blood *hot*.

[pulls out a bottle]
What would you say to a bit of Henry the Fifth?
Ah, you're a mind reader!

[shouting]
Now you are marked... for life!
Alright, the lights are set to 32 miles per hour, just keep going on Sepulveda!
OK, hang on!
[starts to downshift and floor the throttle]

[Two motorcycle cops pull up on either side to check out the girls, and Alice holds up]
Smile!
How fast are we going now?

[with a large fake smile on her face]
32 miles an hour.
This is Roscoe's Last Stand!
One day, Bannon... you *and* Smith!
The age of the motor car is over.
Fifty-five is fast enough to kill you, but slow enough to make you think you're safe.
You know how often my wife tried to get me to get rid of this car? Well that's German machinery for you. The car outlasted her.
Sedately Barney, as befits our years and station in life.
[Barney squeals tires as they leave the parking lot]

[looking up at the sky]
Why! Why me!
You're an asshole, Roscoe. That's why.
From the garage to the Jersey Turnpike, six minutes, fifty-eight seconds. That's fifteen seconds better than last year.

[Last lines]
Um... how are you going to get back to New York?
Hadn't given it much thought.
[pauses]
This is ridiculous.
[pauses]
Where do you get cars around here?
Well, it's America, babe.

[to Professor Graves]
Gumball.
[At the Guest Back Room of Gallagher's Steak House, Michael Bannon welcomes the racers]

Ladies, Gentlemen, you have been selected because you have the necessary skills. You are here because you have the determination to suceed. Now, it won't be as easy as last year. There are some who will use any means to try and stop us. Some of you won't make it. For those of you who do, there'll be no glory, no headlines. But... just a few magic hours flat out against the red line, with no catalytic converter and no 55 mile-an-hour speed limit.
[Guests chuckles]
Ladies and gentlemen... The Gumball Rally has begun!
[Guests cheers and applauds; Smith taps glass to quiet them down]
Um, for those of you who never done this before, I think I better go over the rules. Um, first thing to remember is there are no rules.
[Guests laughs]

The first vehicle to reach the parking lot of the Queen Mary in Long Beach is the winner, the unofficial winner, as this is an unofficial race. And, uh, so it follows thst none of us are in this race. We don't want any civilian involvement. No accidents, please. Remember, it's 2,900 miles. That, 34 hours and 11 minutes, is the record, set last year by our dear friend, Mr. Bannon.
[Guest cheer as Graves shakes Michael's hand]
Now I know we all oughta get some rest tonight, but, uh, may I? I'd like to propose a toast... to internal combustion and wind in the face.
[Franco, Smith, and the crew are at a service station checking out the Ferrari when a woman in a Mercedes-Benz 280SL convertible arrives]

[to the attendant]
Um, fill her up, please.

[to the crew]
Shut it off. Shut it off!

[approaching the woman]
Hello.
Hello.
Where are you going?
Los Angeles.
Driving all night?
Yes.
Alone?
Yes.
You like-a me?
Yes.
Excuse-a one moment. Don't go away.

[as Lapchik passes them]
Would you say that man Lapchik has a certain "joie de vivre"?
I'd say he's possessed of a severe case of masochism!

[watching "The Rabbit" drive off in his T-bucket]
That's the ugliest looking car I ever saw.
Looks like a jukebox.
If you can catch me, you can have me!
